caption: This photograph showcases a close-up view of a sunflower sea star (Pycnopodia helianthoides) being held by hands, partially visible, with a dark-colored wristband or strap visible on one wrist. The sea star is characterized by its multiple robust, armored arms covered in small, spiny protuberances, and stubby spines. It has a dense, granular texture on its surface, and the overall color is a mix of brown, tan, and yellow hues, enhancing its appearance of a living, dynamic creature of the sea. The background of the image is out of focus, highlighting the intricate details and the vibrant, natural composition of the sea star against a soft, muted backdrop. The sea star appears vivid and somewhat moist, suggesting recent removal from its aquatic environment for observation or study.
title: Starfish at Hopkins Marine Institute (Stanford), where marine life of Monterey Bay waters is studied.
